trans-unit.source: Elastic database Split-Merge tool tutorial | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Elastic database Split-Merge tool tutorial | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Splitting and Merging with elastic database tools
trans-unit.target: Splitting and Merging with elastic database tools

trans-unit.source: Elastic database Split-Merge tool tutorial
trans-unit.target: Elastic database Split-Merge tool tutorial

trans-unit.source: Download the Split-Merge packages
trans-unit.target: Download the Split-Merge packages

trans-unit.source: Download the latest NuGet version from [NuGet](http://docs.nuget.org/docs/start-here/installing-nuget).
trans-unit.target: Download the latest NuGet version from [NuGet](http://docs.nuget.org/docs/start-here/installing-nuget).

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt and navigate to the directory where you downloaded nuget.exe.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt and navigate to the directory where you downloaded nuget.exe.

trans-unit.source: Download the latest Split-Merge package into the current directory with the below command:
trans-unit.target: Download the latest Split-Merge package into the current directory with the below command:

trans-unit.source: The steps above download the Split-Merge files to the current directory.
trans-unit.target: The steps above download the Split-Merge files to the current directory.

trans-unit.source: The files are placed in a directory named **Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Service.SplitMerge.x.x.xxx.x** where *x.x.xxx.x* reflects the version number.
trans-unit.target: The files are placed in a directory named **Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Service.SplitMerge.x.x.xxx.x** where *x.x.xxx.x* reflects the version number.

trans-unit.source: Find the Split-Merge Service files in the **content\splitmerge\service** sub-directory, and the Split-Merge PowerShell scripts (and required client .dlls) in the **content\splitmerge\powershell** sub-directory.
trans-unit.target: Find the Split-Merge Service files in the **content\splitmerge\service** sub-directory, and the Split-Merge PowerShell scripts (and required client .dlls) in the **content\splitmerge\powershell** sub-directory.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL DB database that will be used as the Split-Merge status database.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL DB database that will be used as the Split-Merge status database.

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Azure portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Azure portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Create a new **SQL Database**.
trans-unit.target: Create a new **SQL Database**.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the database name and create a new user and password.
trans-unit.target: Fill in the database name and create a new user and password.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to record the name and password for later use.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to record the name and password for later use.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your Azure SQL DB server allows Azure Services to connect to it.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your Azure SQL DB server allows Azure Services to connect to it.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, in the **Firewall Settings**, ensure that the **Allow access to Azure Services** setting is set to **On**.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, in the **Firewall Settings**, ensure that the **Allow access to Azure Services** setting is set to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click the "save" icon.
trans-unit.target: Click the "save" icon.

trans-unit.source: ![Allowed services][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Allowed services][1]

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account that will be used for diagnostics output.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account that will be used for diagnostics output.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: In the left bar, click **New**, click **Data + Storage**, then **Storage**.
trans-unit.target: In the left bar, click **New**, click **Data + Storage**, then **Storage**.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Cloud Service that will contain your Split-Merge service.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Cloud Service that will contain your Split-Merge service.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: In the left bar, click **New**, then **Compute**, **Cloud Service**, and **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the left bar, click **New**, then **Compute**, **Cloud Service**, and **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configuring your Split-Merge service
trans-unit.target: Configuring your Split-Merge service

trans-unit.source: Split-Merge service configuration
trans-unit.target: Split-Merge service configuration

trans-unit.source: In the folder where you downloaded the Split/Merge bits, create a copy of the **ServiceConfiguration.Template.cscfg** file that shipped alongside **SplitMergeService.cspkg** and call it **ServiceConfiguration.cscfg**.
trans-unit.target: In the folder where you downloaded the Split/Merge bits, create a copy of the **ServiceConfiguration.Template.cscfg** file that shipped alongside **SplitMergeService.cspkg** and call it **ServiceConfiguration.cscfg**.

trans-unit.source: Open ServiceConfiguration.cscfg in your favorite text editor.
trans-unit.target: Open ServiceConfiguration.cscfg in your favorite text editor.

trans-unit.source: We recommend using Visual Studio as it will validate inputs such as the format of certificate thumbprints.
trans-unit.target: We recommend using Visual Studio as it will validate inputs such as the format of certificate thumbprints.

trans-unit.source: Either create a new database or choose an existing database to serve as the status database for Split/Merge operations and retrieve the connection string of that database.
trans-unit.target: Either create a new database or choose an existing database to serve as the status database for Split/Merge operations and retrieve the connection string of that database.

trans-unit.source: **Important** At this time, the status database must use the Latin collation (SQL\_Latin1\_General\_CP1\_CI\_AS).
trans-unit.target: **Important** At this time, the status database must use the Latin collation (SQL\_Latin1\_General\_CP1\_CI\_AS).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Windows Collation Name (Transact-SQL)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188046.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Windows Collation Name (Transact-SQL)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms188046.aspx).

trans-unit.source: With Azure SQL DB, the connection string typically is of the form:
trans-unit.target: With Azure SQL DB, the connection string typically is of the form:

trans-unit.source: Enter this connection string in the cscfg file in both the **SplitMergeWeb** and **SplitMergeWorker** role sections in the ElasticScaleMetadata setting.
trans-unit.target: Enter this connection string in the cscfg file in both the **SplitMergeWeb** and **SplitMergeWorker** role sections in the ElasticScaleMetadata setting.

trans-unit.source: For the **SplitMergeWorker** role, enter a valid connection string to Azure storage for the **WorkerRoleSynchronizationStorageAccountConnectionString** setting.
trans-unit.target: For the **SplitMergeWorker** role, enter a valid connection string to Azure storage for the **WorkerRoleSynchronizationStorageAccountConnectionString** setting.

trans-unit.source: Configuring security
trans-unit.target: Configuring security

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions to configure the security of the service, refer to the [Split-Merge security configuration](sql-database-elastic-scale-split-merge-security-configuration.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions to configure the security of the service, refer to the [Split-Merge security configuration](sql-database-elastic-scale-split-merge-security-configuration.md).

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of a simple test deployment suitable to complete this tutorial, a minimal set of configuration steps will be performed to get the service up and running.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of a simple test deployment suitable to complete this tutorial, a minimal set of configuration steps will be performed to get the service up and running.

trans-unit.source: These steps enable only the one machine/account executing them to communicate with the service.
trans-unit.target: These steps enable only the one machine/account executing them to communicate with the service.

trans-unit.source: Creating a self-signed certificate
trans-unit.target: Creating a self-signed certificate

trans-unit.source: Create a new directory and from this directory execute the following command using a [Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms229859.aspx) window:
trans-unit.target: Create a new directory and from this directory execute the following command using a [Developer Command Prompt for Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms229859.aspx) window:

trans-unit.source: You are asked for a password to protect the private key.
trans-unit.target: You are asked for a password to protect the private key.

trans-unit.source: Enter a strong password and confirm it.
trans-unit.target: Enter a strong password and confirm it.

trans-unit.source: You are then prompted for the password to be used once more after that.
trans-unit.target: You are then prompted for the password to be used once more after that.

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes** at the end to import it to the Trusted Certification Authorities Root store.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes** at the end to import it to the Trusted Certification Authorities Root store.

trans-unit.source: Create a PFX file
trans-unit.target: Create a PFX file

trans-unit.source: Execute the following command from the same window where makecert was executed; use the same password that you used to create the certificate:
trans-unit.target: Execute the following command from the same window where makecert was executed; use the same password that you used to create the certificate:

trans-unit.source: Import the client certificate into the personal store
trans-unit.target: Import the client certificate into the personal store

trans-unit.source: In Windows Explorer, double-click **MyCert.pfx**.
trans-unit.target: In Windows Explorer, double-click **MyCert.pfx**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Certificate Import Wizard** select **Current User** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Certificate Import Wizard** select **Current User** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Confirm the file path and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the file path and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Type the password, leave **Include all extended properties** checked and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Type the password, leave **Include all extended properties** checked and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Leave **Automatically select the certificate store[…]** checked and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Leave **Automatically select the certificate store[…]** checked and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Finish** and **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Finish** and **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Upload the PFX file to the cloud service
trans-unit.target: Upload the PFX file to the cloud service

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: Select **Cloud Services**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Cloud Services**.

trans-unit.source: Select the cloud service you created above for the Split/Merge service.
trans-unit.target: Select the cloud service you created above for the Split/Merge service.

trans-unit.source: Click **Certificates** on the top menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **Certificates** on the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Click **Upload** in the bottom bar.
trans-unit.target: Click **Upload** in the bottom bar.

trans-unit.source: Select the PFX file and enter the same password as above.
trans-unit.target: Select the PFX file and enter the same password as above.

trans-unit.source: Once completed, copy the certificate thumbprint from the new entry in the list.
trans-unit.target: Once completed, copy the certificate thumbprint from the new entry in the list.

trans-unit.source: Update the service configuration file
trans-unit.target: Update the service configuration file

trans-unit.source: Paste the certificate thumbprint copied above into the thumbprint/value attribute of these settings.
trans-unit.target: Paste the certificate thumbprint copied above into the thumbprint/value attribute of these settings.

trans-unit.source: For the web role:
trans-unit.target: For the web role:

trans-unit.source: For the worker role:
trans-unit.target: For the worker role:

trans-unit.source: Please note that for production deployments separate certificates should be used for the CA, for encryption, the Server certificate and client certificates.
trans-unit.target: Please note that for production deployments separate certificates should be used for the CA, for encryption, the Server certificate and client certificates.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions on this, see [Security Configuration](sql-database-elastic-scale-split-merge-security-configuration.md).
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions on this, see [Security Configuration](sql-database-elastic-scale-split-merge-security-configuration.md).

trans-unit.source: Deploying your Split-Merge service
trans-unit.target: Deploying your Split-Merge service

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Cloud Services** tab on the left, and select the cloud service that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Cloud Services** tab on the left, and select the cloud service that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the staging environment, then click **Upload a new staging deployment**.
trans-unit.target: Choose the staging environment, then click **Upload a new staging deployment**.

trans-unit.source: ![Staging][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Staging][3]

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box, enter a deployment label.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box, enter a deployment label.

trans-unit.source: For both 'Package' and 'Configuration', click 'From Local' and choose the **SplitMergeService.cspkg** file and your .cscfg file that you configured earlier.
trans-unit.target: For both 'Package' and 'Configuration', click 'From Local' and choose the **SplitMergeService.cspkg** file and your .cscfg file that you configured earlier.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the checkbox labeled **Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance** is checked.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the checkbox labeled **Deploy even if one or more roles contain a single instance** is checked.

trans-unit.source: Hit the tick button in the bottom right to begin the deployment.
trans-unit.target: Hit the tick button in the bottom right to begin the deployment.

trans-unit.source: Expect it to take a few minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Expect it to take a few minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: ![Upload][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Upload][4]

trans-unit.source: Deployment troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Deployment troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If your web role fails to come online, it is likely a problem with the security configuration.
trans-unit.target: If your web role fails to come online, it is likely a problem with the security configuration.

trans-unit.source: Check that the SSL is configured as described above.
trans-unit.target: Check that the SSL is configured as described above.

trans-unit.source: If your worker role fails to come online, but your web role succeeds, it is most likely a problem connecting to the status database that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: If your worker role fails to come online, but your web role succeeds, it is most likely a problem connecting to the status database that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the connection string in your .cscfg is accurate.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the connection string in your .cscfg is accurate.

trans-unit.source: Check that the server and database exist, and that the user id and password are correct.
trans-unit.target: Check that the server and database exist, and that the user id and password are correct.

trans-unit.source: For Azure SQL DB, the connection string should be of the form:
trans-unit.target: For Azure SQL DB, the connection string should be of the form:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the server name does not begin with **https://**.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the server name does not begin with **https://**.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your Azure SQL DB server allows Azure Services to connect to it.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your Azure SQL DB server allows Azure Services to connect to it.

trans-unit.source: To do this, open https://manage.windowsazure.com, click “SQL Databases” on the left, click “Servers” at the top, and select your server.
trans-unit.target: To do this, open https://manage.windowsazure.com, click “SQL Databases” on the left, click “Servers” at the top, and select your server.

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure** at the top and ensure that the **Azure Services** setting is set to “Yes”.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure** at the top and ensure that the **Azure Services** setting is set to “Yes”.

trans-unit.source: (See the Prerequisites section at the top of this article).
trans-unit.target: (See the Prerequisites section at the top of this article).

trans-unit.source: Testing your Split-Merge service deployment
trans-unit.target: Testing your Split-Merge service deployment

trans-unit.source: Connecting with a web browser
trans-unit.target: Connecting with a web browser

trans-unit.source: Determine the web endpoint of your Split-Merge service.
trans-unit.target: Determine the web endpoint of your Split-Merge service.

trans-unit.source: You can find this in the Azure Management Portal by going to the **Dashboard** of your cloud service and looking under **Site URL** on the right side.
trans-unit.target: You can find this in the Azure Management Portal by going to the **Dashboard** of your cloud service and looking under **Site URL** on the right side.

trans-unit.source: Replace **http://** with **https://** since the default security settings disable the HTTP endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Replace **http://** with **https://** since the default security settings disable the HTTP endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Load the page for this URL into your browser.
trans-unit.target: Load the page for this URL into your browser.

trans-unit.source: Testing with PowerShell scripts
trans-unit.target: Testing with PowerShell scripts

trans-unit.source: The deployment and your environment can be tested by running the included sample PowerShell scripts.
trans-unit.target: The deployment and your environment can be tested by running the included sample PowerShell scripts.

trans-unit.source: The script files included are:
trans-unit.target: The script files included are:

trans-unit.source: **SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1** - sets up a test data tier for Split/Merge (see table below for detailed description)
trans-unit.target: **SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1** - sets up a test data tier for Split/Merge (see table below for detailed description)

trans-unit.source: **ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1** - executes test operations on the test data tier (see table below for detailed description)
trans-unit.target: **ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1** - executes test operations on the test data tier (see table below for detailed description)

trans-unit.source: **GetMappings.ps1** – top-level sample script that prints out the current state of the shard mappings.
trans-unit.target: **GetMappings.ps1** – top-level sample script that prints out the current state of the shard mappings.

trans-unit.source: **ShardManagement.psm1** – helper script that wraps the ShardManagement API
trans-unit.target: **ShardManagement.psm1** – helper script that wraps the ShardManagement API

trans-unit.source: **SqlDatabaseHelpers.psm1** – helper script for creating and managing SQL databases
trans-unit.target: **SqlDatabaseHelpers.psm1** – helper script for creating and managing SQL databases

trans-unit.source: PowerShell file
trans-unit.target: PowerShell file

trans-unit.source: Steps
trans-unit.target: Steps

trans-unit.source: SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1
trans-unit.target: SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1

trans-unit.source: Creates a shard map manager database
trans-unit.target: Creates a shard map manager database

trans-unit.source: Creates 2 shard databases.
trans-unit.target: Creates 2 shard databases.

trans-unit.source: Creates a shard map for those database (deletes any existing shard maps on those databases).
trans-unit.target: Creates a shard map for those database (deletes any existing shard maps on those databases).

trans-unit.source: Creates a small sample table in both the shards, and populates the table in one of the shards.
trans-unit.target: Creates a small sample table in both the shards, and populates the table in one of the shards.

trans-unit.source: Declares the SchemaInfo for the sharded table.
trans-unit.target: Declares the SchemaInfo for the sharded table.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell file
trans-unit.target: PowerShell file

trans-unit.source: Steps
trans-unit.target: Steps

trans-unit.source: ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1
trans-unit.target: ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1

trans-unit.source: Sends a split request to the Split-Merge Service web frontend, which splits half the data from the first shard to the second shard.
trans-unit.target: Sends a split request to the Split-Merge Service web frontend, which splits half the data from the first shard to the second shard.

trans-unit.source: Polls the web frontend for the split request status and waits until the request completes.
trans-unit.target: Polls the web frontend for the split request status and waits until the request completes.

trans-unit.source: Sends a merge request to the Split-Merge Service web frontend, which moves the data from the second shard back to the first shard.
trans-unit.target: Sends a merge request to the Split-Merge Service web frontend, which moves the data from the second shard back to the first shard.

trans-unit.source: Polls the web frontend for the merge request status and waits until the request completes.
trans-unit.target: Polls the web frontend for the merge request status and waits until the request completes.

trans-unit.source: Using PowerShell to verify your deployment
trans-unit.target: Using PowerShell to verify your deployment

trans-unit.source: Open a new PowerShell window and navigate to the directory where you downloaded the Split-Merge package, and then navigate into the “powershell” directory.
trans-unit.target: Open a new PowerShell window and navigate to the directory where you downloaded the Split-Merge package, and then navigate into the “powershell” directory.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL database server (or choose an existing server) where the shard map manager and shards will be created.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL database server (or choose an existing server) where the shard map manager and shards will be created.

trans-unit.source: Execute the SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1 script to create the sample environment.
trans-unit.target: Execute the SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1 script to create the sample environment.

trans-unit.source: Execute the Getmappings.ps1 script to view the mappings that currently exist in the sample environment.
trans-unit.target: Execute the Getmappings.ps1 script to view the mappings that currently exist in the sample environment.

trans-unit.source: .\GetMappings.ps1 ` -UserName 'mysqluser' `
trans-unit.target: .\GetMappings.ps1 ` -UserName 'mysqluser' `

trans-unit.source: -Password 'MySqlPassw0rd' `
trans-unit.target: -Password 'MySqlPassw0rd' `

trans-unit.source: -ShardMapManagerServerName 'abcdefghij.database.windows.net'
trans-unit.target: -ShardMapManagerServerName 'abcdefghij.database.windows.net'

trans-unit.source: Execute the ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1 script to execute a split operation (moving half the data on the first shard to the second shard) and then a merge operation (moving the data back onto the first shard).
trans-unit.target: Execute the ExecuteSampleSplitMerge.ps1 script to execute a split operation (moving half the data on the first shard to the second shard) and then a merge operation (moving the data back onto the first shard).

trans-unit.source: If you configured SSL and left the http endpoint disabled, ensure that you use the https:// endpoint instead.
trans-unit.target: If you configured SSL and left the http endpoint disabled, ensure that you use the https:// endpoint instead.

trans-unit.source: Experiment with other data types!
trans-unit.target: Experiment with other data types!

trans-unit.source: All of these scripts take an optional -ShardKeyType parameter that allows you to specify the key type.
trans-unit.target: All of these scripts take an optional -ShardKeyType parameter that allows you to specify the key type.

trans-unit.source: The default is Int32, but you can also specify Int64, Guid, or Binary.
trans-unit.target: The default is Int32, but you can also specify Int64, Guid, or Binary.

trans-unit.source: Creating your own requests
trans-unit.target: Creating your own requests

trans-unit.source: The service can be used either by using the web UI or by importing and using the SplitMerge.psm1 PowerShell module which will submit your requests through the web role.
trans-unit.target: The service can be used either by using the web UI or by importing and using the SplitMerge.psm1 PowerShell module which will submit your requests through the web role.

trans-unit.source: The Split-Merge service can move data in both sharded tables and reference tables.
trans-unit.target: The Split-Merge service can move data in both sharded tables and reference tables.

trans-unit.source: A sharded table has a sharding key column and has different row data on each shard.
trans-unit.target: A sharded table has a sharding key column and has different row data on each shard.

trans-unit.source: A reference table is not sharded so it contains the same row data on every shard.
trans-unit.target: A reference table is not sharded so it contains the same row data on every shard.

trans-unit.source: Reference tables are useful for data that does not change often and is used to JOIN with sharded tables in queries.
trans-unit.target: Reference tables are useful for data that does not change often and is used to JOIN with sharded tables in queries.

trans-unit.source: In order to perform a split-merge operation, you must declare the sharded tables and reference tables that you want to have moved.
trans-unit.target: In order to perform a split-merge operation, you must declare the sharded tables and reference tables that you want to have moved.

trans-unit.source: This is accomplished with the **SchemaInfo** API.
trans-unit.target: This is accomplished with the **SchemaInfo** API.

trans-unit.source: This API is in the **Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.ShardManagement.Schema** namespace.
trans-unit.target: This API is in the **Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.ShardManagement.Schema** namespace.

trans-unit.source: For each sharded table, create a **ShardedTableInfo** object describing the table’s parent schema name (optional, defaults to “dbo”), the table name, and the column name in that table that contains the sharding key.
trans-unit.target: For each sharded table, create a **ShardedTableInfo** object describing the table’s parent schema name (optional, defaults to “dbo”), the table name, and the column name in that table that contains the sharding key.

trans-unit.source: For each reference table, create a **ReferenceTableInfo** object describing the table’s parent schema name (optional, defaults to “dbo”) and the table name.
trans-unit.target: For each reference table, create a **ReferenceTableInfo** object describing the table’s parent schema name (optional, defaults to “dbo”) and the table name.

trans-unit.source: Add the above TableInfo objects to a new **SchemaInfo** object.
trans-unit.target: Add the above TableInfo objects to a new **SchemaInfo** object.

trans-unit.source: Get a reference to a **ShardMapManager** object, and call **GetSchemaInfoCollection**.
trans-unit.target: Get a reference to a **ShardMapManager** object, and call **GetSchemaInfoCollection**.

trans-unit.source: Add the **SchemaInfo** to the **SchemaInfoCollection**, providing the shard map name.
trans-unit.target: Add the **SchemaInfo** to the **SchemaInfoCollection**, providing the shard map name.

trans-unit.source: An example of this can be seen in the SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1 script.
trans-unit.target: An example of this can be seen in the SetupSampleSplitMergeEnvironment.ps1 script.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Split-Merge service does not create the target database (or schema for any tables in the database) for you.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Split-Merge service does not create the target database (or schema for any tables in the database) for you.

trans-unit.source: They must be pre-created before sending a request to the service.
trans-unit.target: They must be pre-created before sending a request to the service.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: You may see the below message when running the sample powershell scripts:
trans-unit.target: You may see the below message when running the sample powershell scripts:

trans-unit.source: This error means that your SSL certificate is not configured correctly.
trans-unit.target: This error means that your SSL certificate is not configured correctly.

trans-unit.source: Please follow the instructions in section 'Connecting with a web browser'.
trans-unit.target: Please follow the instructions in section 'Connecting with a web browser'.

trans-unit.source: If you cannot submit requests you may see this:
trans-unit.target: If you cannot submit requests you may see this:

trans-unit.source: [Exception] System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException (0x80131904): Could not find stored procedure 'dbo.InsertRequest'.
trans-unit.target: [Exception] System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException (0x80131904): Could not find stored procedure 'dbo.InsertRequest'.

trans-unit.source: In this case, check your configuration file, in particular the setting for **WorkerRoleSynchronizationStorageAccountConnectionString**.
trans-unit.target: In this case, check your configuration file, in particular the setting for **WorkerRoleSynchronizationStorageAccountConnectionString**.

trans-unit.source: This error typically indicates that the worker role could not successfully initialize the metadata database on first use.
trans-unit.target: This error typically indicates that the worker role could not successfully initialize the metadata database on first use.
